revised_title: Ameliorating High Pressure Nervous Syndrome in Deep Diving
tldr: Researchers developed a new breathing gas mixture called Trimix to help divers avoid the high pressure nervous syndrome (h.p.n.s.) when diving deep underwater. By using a slow compression rate and adding small amounts of nitrogen to the oxygen-helium mixture, divers can safely reach depths of up to 686 meters. This technique requires careful selection of divers and the use of 5-8% nitrogen in the Heliox mixture.
